description: This course is a history of Western civilization's primary cultures, Ancient Greece from the Bronze Age through the "Golden Age" of classical Greece and the empire of Alexander the Great. Offered periodically. Also counts toward ancient studies, classics, and Greek majors.
name: Ancient Greek History

notes: Modern peoples have used the Ancient Greeks to construct much of their identity
and culture, especially in Europe and English-speaking parts of North America
and Australasia. Much of what we take for granted in modern society was
constructed from 18th and 19th century European interpretations about Greece
(which were themselves constructed by Greek and Roman elite male authors): the
Patriarchy, democracy, theatre, philosophy, rhetoric, the writing of history,

title: Ancient: Greece
